content.question: In Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, a person uses a pulley to lift a bell. The person pulls down on the rope at a constant speed. Power <math alttext="P sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is delivered to the bell and it moves upward at a constant speed. In Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the person uses a double pulley. The person pulls down on the rope at the same constant speed. The bell again moves upward at a constant speed, but the speed of the bell is half the speed of the bell in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. The power delivered to the bell in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is <math alttext="P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> to <math alttext="P sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="P sub 2 is less than P sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, because in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> the force exerted on the bell is the same but it is moving with less speed than in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.

<math alttext="P sub 2 is less than P sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, because in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> the force exerted on the bell is less than in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.

<math alttext="P sub 2 equals P sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, because in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> the speed is half that in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, but the force on the bell is twice that in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.

<math alttext="P sub 2 equals P sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, because in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> the person is doing the same amount of work on the bell as in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="P sub 2 is less than P sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, because in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> the force exerted on the bell is the same but it is moving with less speed than in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.
